revised_title: Anatomical Varieties of Neck, Shoulder, and Chest Muscles in Mammals
tldr: The author examines various muscle varieties in the human neck, shoulder, and chest, as well as their transitional forms and homologies in mammals. The study includes observations of the occipito-scapular, levator claviculce, and cleido-occipital muscles, among others, and discusses their anatomical connections and evolutionary relationships across different species.
